alert.note: Alert for Garza; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 12:08PM CDT until June 01 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN GARZA AND NORTHEASTERN LYNN COUNTIES... At 1208 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Public report of wreck on US-84 southbound between Southland and Post blocking traffic. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Post, Southland, Grassland and Wilson. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
